Policy Matter Technical (155/ 2014) (Decision taken in 192nd meeting of EC held on 07.05.2014 vide Agenda Item No.V) Sub:: Guidelines regarding Extension of Time cases in Consultancy Contracts In supersession of the existing guidelines on the subiect; following guidelines for processing of extension of time cases related to DPRIFeasibility Consultancy, Supervision Consultancy and Independent Engineer services are issued: i) In case of Consultancy Services (Feasibility Study/DPR, Supervision Consultancy, Independent Engineer Services), the Competent Authority for grant of extension of  time shall be the concerned Regional Officer   where the proposal does not involve any financial implication to NHAI: In case of Independent Engineering (IE) services; the contarct period shall be inclusive of construction period and o&M period. O&M shall not be treated a8 separate for the purpose of extension of time: As an illustration, if IE is engaged for a project for a duration of 48 months (36 months for_construction and 12 months for O&M) and COD is delayed and is achieved in 48 months the contract duration for IE services shall be considered as over and separate IE for O&M period shall be engaged: ii) Engagement of IE for O&M period after expiry of the period of previous IE shall be taken up at RO level at appropriate time s0 that no extension to previous IE is required. After evaluating the bids, the   proposal shall be sent to the Headquarters for approval only. iii) The  proposal  for extension of time cases related to Feasibility/DPR involving financial implication shall be approved at Chairman's level. iv) The proposal for extension of time cases related to Supervision Consultancy and Independent Engineer Services  shall be approved at CGM level in HQ if the extension of time involves financial implication upto 25% of the consultancy cost: 'The proposal for extension of time cases related to Supervision Consultancy and Independent Engineer Services shall be approved at Member level if the extension of time involves financial implication upto 50% of the consultancy cost: 71 ?t NHAI May period
